title.narrative: Humanitarian and Protection Assistance for Syrian Refugees in Jordan

description.narrative:
ICMC provides assistance and protection to Syrian refugees and extremely vulnerable Jordanian families to alleviate the pressures of displacement and population growth.
ICMC seeks to enhance the quality of life of extremely vulnerable persons by providing emergency items meeting their basic hygiene and household needs. Depending on their situation and needs, Syrian refugees and Jordanians may receive : • hygiene packages for infants and small children ; • house cleaning kits; • packages containing winter items, including gas cylinders, gas heaters, vouchers for gas refills and high quality thermal blankets; • educational recreation kits for Syrian refugee and Jordanian children attending the child friendly space at the ICMC Protection Center, including a school bag with books and stationary.
ICMC promotes the dignity of vulnerable Syrian and Jordanian tenants, serves as their advocate and addresses their immediate humanitarian needs by covering their rental costs.
ICMC also operates a Protection Center in Al Mafraq which offers a social and safe space for vulnerable Syrian refugee women, young girls, and children to meet and supports their well-being by: • Enhancing adult and youth knowledge of protection risks and the resources and support services available, through awareness raising, advocacy and focus group sessions; • Improving literacy levels and empowering women and girls through literacy classes; • Providing a secure child friendly space where children can play, learn and participate in structured educational and recreational activities.
